Package me.wobblyyyy.rlibx.input.controllers

Class ControllerEncoder

java.lang.Object
me.wobblyyyy.rlibx.input.controllers.ControllerEncoder
public class ControllerEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
Utilities used to encode a controller's state into a much more useful state: an input channel array.

Encoding isn't a difficult concept to grasp - you simply convert one way of storing data to another way of storing data. Although it isn't hard to do, encoding a controller state into an array of values for an input device to use takes up a lot of words.

Since:
0.1.0
Author:
Colin Robertson
See Also:
ControllerState, InputDevice

    • booleanToDouble

      private static double booleanToDouble​(boolean input)
      Transform a boolean into a double.

      The following ruleset applies here:

      • 1.0 = true
      • 0.0 = false

      Parameters:
      input - the input boolean.
      Returns:
      the output double.

    • decode

      public static ControllerState decode​(double[] z)
      Decode an encoded array of double values, used by an input channel, into a much more human-readable ControllerState.
      Parameters:
      z - the array of doubles to be decoded.
      Returns:
      the ControllerState of the decoded double array.
